titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Holmes family papers 1977.632
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:39:17 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection contains the Holmes family's legal papers, including: papers concerning the estate of Daniel Holmes; an affidavit concerning the death of John Holmes; a notification of settlement for the estate of Lothrop Holmes; petitions from Burroughs and Rosekrans Holmes concerning the estate of their father, Thomas; and the last will and testament of Edward Holmes. The Holmes family lived in various counties in upstate New York, including Westchester, Albany, Cayuga, and Saratoga counties.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: The Holmes family lived in various counties in upstate New York, including Westchester, Albany, Cayuga, and Saratoga counties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the Holmes family's legal papers, including: papers concerning the estate of Daniel Holmes; an affidavit concerning the death of John Holmes; a notification of settlement for the estate of Lothrop Holmes; petitions from Burroughs and Rosekrans Holmes concerning the estate of their father, Thomas; and the last will and testament of Edward Holmes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Holmes family papers, 1977.632, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1977.
